title: Bloodborne comes to PC, sort of, with PlayStation Now | Trusted Reviews
description:
![](https://ksassets.timeincuk.net/wp/uploads/sites/54/2017/07/trusted-
reviews-placeholder-3.svg)

**PlayStation Now has added Bloodborne to its library, meaning you can now
play Hidetaka Miyazaki’s _other_ franchise on your PC for the low price of a
subscription to PlayStation Now. **

It’s a workaround, admittedly. But despite the rampant success of Dark Souls
on PC, Sony owns the rights to Bloodborne, meaning the legions of Dark Souls
fans that only own a PC are unlikely to see if show up on the steam
marketplace.

Our former games editor Sam gave
[Bloodborne](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/bloodborne) a 9./10 and
it’s become an instant classic, sharing a nightmarish tone, brutal combat and
alien lore with Dark Souls, but with a more aggressive combat style that
prioritises constant pressure. It’s quite unique, and honestly worth a go if
you haven’t played it before.

**Related:[Best PC Games](https://www.trustedreviews.com/best/best-pc-
games-3520096)**

So, to the rescue comes PlayStation Now, Sony’s premium streaming service that
allows subscribers to play a library of PlayStation titles on their PS4 or PC.
Right now, you can get a free seven-day trial of the service, and there’s a
[promotion](https://blog.us.playstation.com/2018/06/05/playstation-now-
streaming-library-hits-650-games-summer-deals-revealed/) that means new
subscribers can sign up cheap.

A couple of caveats. While I haven’t experienced it myself in my limited
experience with PlayStation Now, there are complaints of input lag and latency
issues, especially if you’re not currently on a wired connection to the
internet. Your mileage may vary though, and you could absolutely test that out
during a free trial if Bloodborne for PC is what you desire.

It’s not just Bloodborne, either. The service also offers the only way to play
the original [God of War](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/god-of-war-
iii) trilogy, [Red Dead
Redemption](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/red-dead-redemption) and
[The Last of Us](https://www.trustedreviews.com/reviews/the-last-of-us) on PC.
The kicker is that the app for the service doesn’t support a mouse and
keyboard, nor third-party controllers. If you want to play PlayStation games
on your PC, you’ll need to fork out for a DUALSHOCK4 to play them with.
